content.description: Another slab climb up the meaty middle.
content.protection: Bring gear long slings to set up TR.  No placements for a lead.
content.location: Middle of the slab.  Climb Rump Roast to set up a TR or scramble.

content.description: Usually free soloed to set up a top rope on the other two slab climbs on this wall. No need to free solo. Access to Top rope anchors is easily accessible on the right side. Only top rope gear is needed.
content.protection: Bring gear long slings to set up TR. No placements for a lead. Â TR is accessible with an easy scramble on the right side of wall.
content.location: Left and easiest line up the meat slab.  Good for working on those friction skills.  Climbing at the Refuge, you will need them.

content.description: Climb the crack that is at the start of T-Bone up and to the left. The crux is a small rise just before a ledge 15 feet below the top. Traverse the ledge back to the right and finish with an easy face climb to the right of middle water streak. The crack is protectable with large cams and hexes, but I prefer to set it up as a top rope for first time climbers. This route doesn't require the friction skills of the other climbs on the wall.
content.protection: Large Cams and Hexes. To admins and staff: There are now anchors at the top of the middle water streak on this climb and rap rings at the top of the 5.7 to the right. I don't know if the WMCC did this. I hope so, but they were there, all the same.
content.location: Route is located on the Meat Slab in The Narrows. The start is the large, obvious crack to the left of center. There's an easy scramble off to the right when you are facing the wall from below.

content.description: The hardest and longest climb at the Meat Slab.  Probably the best route on the wall.
content.location: Right most route on the wall next to the riverbed.

content.description: Three slab climbs, all top ropes.  For tuning up your friction skills.  Recently added a 4th line near the river.
